titleproper.value: Guide to the Elinor Miller Papers <lb/><date calendar="gregorian" era="ce">1977-2004</date><lb/><num>MSS 178</num> <num>MSS.178</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Processed by Lindsay Kaplan, 2006, and Nicole Kenley, 2007.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-05-12T17:24:57</date>

abstract.value: The Elinor Miller Papers consist largely of letters to Miller from Michel Butor, a prominent French author, and of Miller's collection of published material by or about Butor. Some of Miller's own letters to Butor are included, and some of her correspondence on the subject of Butor. Also included are various mixed media focusing on several artists with whom Butor often collaborated, and whom Miller also studied in their relation to the author.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); Elinor Miller Papers; MSS 178; [box number]; [folder number]; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
The collection was donated by the family of Elinor Miller in 2004.

Michel Butor was one of the pioneers of the Nouveau roman in France. The New Novel surfaced in France in the early 1950s (though some works predate this estimate by several years), and remained the dominant form of avant-garde literature throughout the 1950s and early 1960s. Michel Butor, whose novel <emph render="italic">La Modification</emph>won the Prix Renaudot in 1957, helped this bold new Ã©criture gain wider acclaim both in France and abroad. He later branched out to work on critical essays, poetry, non- fiction, non-non-fiction, translations, artistic and musical collaborations, and much more.

subject.value: French fiction |y 20th century |x History and criticism.
French fiction |y 19th century |x History and criticism.

dsc.value:
Series I: Correspondence, Butor to MillerScope and Contents note

This series contains Michel Butor's letters to Elinor Miller from 1977 to 2004. The letters are all collages with moving pieces, images, and text. Some include family photos, invitations to exhibition openings, conference programs, collaborative postcards, and more.

Contents note

Series II is less comprehensive than Series I, as Butor donated his letters from Miller to the BibliothÃ¨que Nationale de France, and Miller did not keep copies of all of her letters to Butor. This series also includes clippings and photos that Miller had intended to send along to Butor, and correspondence between Miller and various other people who have some connection to Butor.

Correspondence from Elinor Miller to Michel Butor1977/1989283Correspondence from Elinor Miller to Michel Butor1990284Correspondence from Elinor Miller to Michel Butor1991285Correspondence from Elinor Miller to Michel Butor1992286Correspondence from Elinor Miller to Michel Butor1993287Correspondence from Elinor Miller to Michel Butor1997288Correspondence from Elinor Miller to Michel Butor1998289Correspondence between Elinor Miller and Maxime Godard2002290Correspondence between Elinor Miller and Lorraine BÃ©nic1996291Other Correspondence to and from Elinor MillerVarious292Correspondence from Elinor Miller - Fragmentsundated293Elinor Miller's personal file entitled "To send Butor"undated294Series III: Mixed Media/CollaborationsScope and Contents note

This series is comprised of mixed media depicting the work of several artists with whom Butor collaborated. Miller's labeling titles have been retained. Miller wrote on these artists and their collaborations with Butor, and taught classes on them as well. There are slides, photos, photo CDs, and audiocassettes. There is also a VHS of a Butor interview.

The printed material included in the collection consists of secondary works and catalogs. The secondary sources are arranged alphabetically by author, the catalogs alphabetically by title.
